DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: Lazertinib works by blocking the activity of abnormal EGFR proteins that signal cancer cells to divide. This keeps cancer cells from growing and may kill them. Lazertinib can reach cancer cells in the brain, enabling it to treat cancers that have spread there. It is a type of targeted therapy drug called an EGFR tyrosine kinase inhibitor.

Section.Title: Use in Cancer
Section.Para: Lazertinib mesylate hydrate is approved to treat adults with:

ItemizedList.ListItem: non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) that has spread to other parts of the body or cannot be removed by surgery and has an abnormal EGFR gene. It is used with amivantamab as the first treatment.
